description: Creates a virtual router within a service mesh. Specify a listener for any inbound traffic that your virtual router receives. Create a virtual router for each protocol and port that you need to route. Virtual routers handle traffic for one or more virtual services within your mesh. After you create your virtual router, create and associate routes for your virtual router that direct incoming requests to different virtual nodes. For more information about virtual routers, see Virtual routers.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Up to 36 letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores are allowed. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: meshName
parameters.description: The name of the service mesh to create the virtual router in.

parameters.name: spec
parameters.description: The virtual router specification to apply. listeners (list) --- The listeners that the virtual router is expected to receive inbound traffic from. You can specify one listener. (dict) --- An object that represents a virtual router listener. An object that represents a port mapping. The port used for the port mapping. The protocol used for the port mapping. Specify one protocol.

nested_params.name: listeners
nested_params.description: The listeners that the virtual router is expected to receive inbound traffic from. You can specify one listener.

nested_params.name: portMapping
nested_params.description: An object that represents a port mapping.

nested_params.name: port
nested_params.description: The port used for the port mapping.

nested_params.name: protocol
nested_params.description: The protocol used for the port mapping. Specify one protocol.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Optional metadata that you can apply to the virtual router to assist with categorization and organization. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters. (dict) --- Optional metadata that you apply to a resource to assist with categorization and organization. One part of a key-value pair that make up a tag. A key is a general label that acts like a category for more specific tag values. The optional part of a key-value pair that make up a tag. A value acts as a descriptor within a tag category (key).

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: One part of a key-value pair that make up a tag. A key is a general label that acts like a category for more specific tag values.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The optional part of a key-value pair that make up a tag. A value acts as a descriptor within a tag category (key).

parameters.name: virtualRouterName
parameters.description: The name to use for the virtual router.

nested_items.name: virtualRouter
nested_items.description: The full description of your virtual router following the create call.

nested_items.name: meshName
nested_items.description: The name of the service mesh that the virtual router resides in.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was last updated.

nested_items.name: meshOwner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

nested_items.name: resourceOwner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services IAM account ID of the resource owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the mesh owner or of another account that the mesh is shared with. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

nested_items.name: uid
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the resource.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version of the resource. Resources are created at version 1, and this version is incremented each time that they're updated.

nested_items.name: listeners
nested_items.description: The listeners that the virtual router is expected to receive inbound traffic from. You can specify one listener.

nested_items.name: portMapping
nested_items.description: An object that represents a port mapping.

nested_items.name: port
nested_items.description: The port used for the port mapping.

nested_items.name: protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol used for the port mapping. Specify one protocol.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current status of the virtual router.

nested_items.name: virtualRouterName
nested_items.description: The name of the virtual router.
